main.name: Deepthy Sharon
main.bio:
Coding was not my first IT destination. For me, achieving in milestones in testing have been important in preparing me for the coding challenges in Software development.
 Even though I earned Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Engineering, I never had a chance to work as a developer. I have been a software tester doing my manual testing for few years and finally made a jump to developer.
By working as a tester, my eyes were wide open to find bugs, aware of all process. But at end of the day, I felt dissatisfied and empty thinking that I spent the whole day testing something that someone else has developed. I was always good at problem solving and finding solutions.
I started looking into technologies to switch to. I finally found the sweet spot in JavaScipt. As, I went on learning, I started to do small projects to get hands-on experience. Nothing teaches you better than yourown mistakes. Keep making mistakes and correcting them. That’s, how I learned.
I got an opportunity to study React JS from ComIT, where again I got a chance to learn new language. After doing a couple of projects in Front-end, I had eagerness to learn more about back-end and Database.
I enrolled in Full Stack development course with Lighthouse labs. With 3 months of intense training, I worked on several projects (Front-end and Back-end). Each project was a challenge that I loved to solved in a logical way.
I try to learn and get better every day. This journey is long and full of challenges and there is no destination, only milestones.

work.title: Digital Skills Instructor
work.description: facilitating a weekly code club that introduced 15-20 children aged 8 to 12 to programming, creating lesson plans to teach material virtually to children with different levels of programming knowledge, developing interactive activities such as online quizzes and presentation to keep children engaged and test understanding.
